Yesterday seems to be the third major up-tick of violence from the HK Police.
Remember, as hard as it is to watch or experience first hand, as most Hong Kongers now are, regimes that increase the violence to protect themselves are actually signalling their weakness, not their strength.
The police are a law unto themselves now and only answer to Peking. Across the board, they see anyone who is a protester as less than human. This is key, as CCP is queuing them up to kill Hong Kong people. This is not a matter of if, but when.
The messages they want to send to Hong Kongers are,
a) Being anywhere on the street near a protester is illegal and will be met with violence.
b) Being anywhere near the police is illegal and will be met with violence.
Police aren’t interested in taking people to court or charging them. This is State terrorism, pure and simple.
Citizens can only avoid violence by staying home. And by home that means, your apartment. Residential complexes and public spaces can become no-go areas if the police deem them to be.
This is now an epic power struggle between a violent armed State and a united, but unarmed populace.
Peking sees that HK is no longer a global news story. HK can no longer grab the world headlines with million man marches, because the police have made it too dangerous for most people to go out and amass. The international media is only interested if there is a) a solution b) the PLA come. c) a massacre. CCP is trying to play this global media apathy to their advantage. This is a deliberate and calculating tactic by Peking to break the deadlock and come out as winners over a broken city - no concessions, no solutions, no mass marches, bcus violence is too high, no PLA, bcus HK police will gladly terrorise citizens day after day.
People I meet keep asking me, what is the end game?
The answer is as simple as it is epic. The end of the CCP.
Hong Kongers have awakened the world to the malign intent of a China led by CCP. Hong Kongers are paying the price in tears and blood for 30 years of global appeasement of this terrible regime.
Who can tell when the end will come, but we are the beginning of the end for CCP.
Hong Kongers will keep fighting for their city, and in doing so they are actually changing the world.
